intro: Dorstenia crispa, commonly known as the brittlestem or zigzag plant, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique, twisted stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Dorstenia crispa is typically found in shaded, moist environments and is often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and interesting species within its native habitat.
